section.title: Create program
section.para: java.util.prefs.Preferences can be easily used. You have to define a node in which the data is stored. Then you can call the getter and setter methods. The second value is the default value, e.g. if the preference value is not set yet, then this value will be used.

section.title: Validating
section.para: Run the program twice. The value of "ID1" should be written with its default value (true) to the command line, as the preference value was deleted at the end of the method. The value of "ID2" and "ID3" should have changed after the first call.
